New Records: Fakhar Zaman became only the second Pakistan batter to hit five or more sixes in an ODI World Cup game.
Only Imran Nazir has hit more sixes than Fakhar Zaman for Pakistan in an ODI World Cup game.
Key Match Events: Pakistan won the powerplay battle, scoring 52 for 0 at the end of the powerplay.
Fakhar Zaman and Abdullah Shafique put on 128 for the opening stand, with both batters hitting impressive half-centuries.
Pakistan successfully chased a World Cup game with more deliveries remaining, only the third time in their history.
Pakistan bowlers and Fakhar Zaman and Abdullah Shafique laid the groundwork for a resounding Pakistan victory at the Eden Gardens.
Shakib Al Hasan has launched himself into the attack and he is a threat Pakistan will be wary of.
Fakhar Zaman hit 81 off 74 in his comeback game, smashing seven sixes and three fours.
Abdullah Shafique scored two sixes and nine fours in his 69-ball 68.
Pakistan's win was set up by the bowling unit, with Shaheen Shah Afridi and Haris Rauf starting the slide for Bangladesh before Iftikhar Ahmed and Usama Mir picking up a couple of wickets.
Pakistan have now played seven matches at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata, and won six of them.
Pakistan's love affair with Eden Gardens continues.
Pre-Game Insights: Shakib Al Hasan has launched himself into the attack and he is a threat Pakistan will be wary of.
Pakistan need to get with the times, they have lacked the power and aggression to keep up with the best batting teams in ODIs.
Pakistan can still make the semi-finals, but how? Will they be knocked out if they lose to Bangladesh today? Or will there be hope for them still.
Pakistan are still (at least technically) in the running for a semi-finals spot, while for Bangladesh, it's a fight for a Champions Trophy spot.
One battle to watch out for at the top will be Litton Das against Shaheen Shah Afridi.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan win the powerplay battle, scoring 52 for 0 at the end of the powerplay.
Pakistan stay alive, Bangladesh are officially knocked out.
Pakistan kept their hopes of a semi-finals spot alive with this seven-wicket victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cricket Association of Bengal hosted over 500 children at the Eden Gardens today.
Pakistan's win was originally set up by the bowling unit.
Pakistan's love affair with Eden Gardens continues.
Pakistan have won 78% of the games where Shaheen has taken two or more powerplay wickets.
Pakistan's batting issues have been a topic of discussion.
Pakistan's road to the semis... is a narrow one.
Others: The Eden Gardens has been a happy hunting ground for Pakistan across decades and generations.
Pakistan's captain, Babar Azam, rough run of form in the World Cup continues.
Fakhar Zaman's return to the side has been marked with a solid knock.
Abdullah Shafique has taken the attack to Mustafizur Rahman.
Fakhar Zaman has registered his highest score since his unbeaten 180 against New Zealand.
